item.title: What Is Toll Free?
item.description:
The term “toll free number” is widely recognized, with most people having used one. But what exactly does it mean and how do businesses acquire them? Unlike standard phone numbers automatically assigned with landline, VoIP, or cellular services, toll free numbers require a separate process. In the US and Canada, phone numbers follow the North American Numbering Plan (NANP) format: 1-NPA-NXX-XXXX. In this format, “1” represents the country code, NPA stands for Numbering Plan Area (area code), and the remaining digits are unique to your line...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/what-is-toll-free/

item.title: Ethernet over TDM
item.description:
You might be familiar with Ethernet over Copper and Ethernet over Fiber, but have you encountered Ethernet over TDM? It’s worth understanding this technology and its potential benefits.
](http://www.copperethernet.com/)
TDM, or Time Division Multiplexing, forms the foundation of T1 lines and SONET fiber optic services. It became the standard for the Public Switched Telephone Network (PSTN) during its transition from analog to digital in the mid-20th century and remains relevant due to its continued prevalence...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/ethernet-over-tdm/

item.title: The Surprising Low Cost Phone Option
item.description:
You might assume that with the popularity of bundled services and internet-based phone options, old-fashioned landlines are obsolete. However, combining this older technology with a competitively priced long-distance service might be the most cost-effective choice. To determine the most affordable option, you need to analyze your needs. Start with the most basic local service, which usually means just having a dial tone. You might find better deals from smaller companies than traditional phone companies...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/the-surprising-low-cost-phone-option/

item.title: How Does a VoIP Call Work?
item.description:
VoIP is often called a network service, not a phone service, which matters for technical folks and business owners, but less so for everyday users. After all, a phone is a phone; you expect it to work the same way. The aim with VoIP has been to closely replicate the experience of traditional landlines. Now that this is largely accomplished, the focus is shifting towards making VoIP calls sound even better than traditional calls, aiming for what’s called HD or high-definition voice...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/how-does-a-voip-call-work/

item.title: Try VoIP Phone Service For Under $10 a Month
item.description:
Ever considered trying out those new VoIP phone services to see if they’re better than your old landline? The ads are tempting, offering combined local and long-distance billing, tons of features without extra charges, and cheap international rates. It all sounds great and much cheaper than your current plan. Hesitations are understandable. Will you like the service? Will it work well with your internet? Maybe long-term contracts, especially at $40-$50 a month, aren’t appealing...

item.description:

TEL3Business offers tools to manage your business calls, whether from landlines or mobile phones. item.description:
